item.title: K.V. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: K.V. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: K.V. add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: K.V. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: K.V. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You will always be fond of me. I represent to you all the sins you never had the courage to commit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: K.V. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I like persons better than principles, and I like persons with no principles better than anything else in the world." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: K.V. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Wickedness is a myth invented by good people to account for the curious attractiveness of others." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: K.V. add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "When I think of all the harm [the Bible] has done, I despair of ever writing anything to equal it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: K.V. add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: K.V. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty." -- Mark Twain

item.title: K.V. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "There was never yet an uninteresting life. Such a thing is an impossibility. Inside of the dullest exterior there is a drama, a comedy, and a tragedy." -- Mark Twain

item.title: K.V. add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "It would be absurd if we did not understand both angels and devils, since we invented them." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: K.V. add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I shall revenge myself in the cruelest way you can imagine. I shall forget it." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: K.V. add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Writers aren’t people exactly. Or, if they’re any good, they’re a whole lot of people trying so hard to be one person." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: K.V. add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: K.V. add a quote by ZORA NEALE HURSTON
item.description: "Sometimes, I feel discriminated against, but it does not make me angry. It merely astonishes me. How <i>can</i> any deny themselves the pleasure of my company? It’s beyond me." -- ZORA NEALE HURSTON
